pageContext.claim: “The HISTORIC Rescissions Package we’ve proposed would cut $15,000,000,000 in Wasteful Spending! We are getting our government back on track.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's rescission request is a drop in the bucket, representing roughly 1 percent of the $1.3 trillion omnibus spending bill he signed in March 2018. The U.S. budget deficit has been growing under Trump because of the combined effect of spending and tax cuts. It was $532.24 billion from October 2017 through May 2018, a 23 percent increase from the year-earlier period, and will surpass $1 trillion by 2020, two years sooner than previously estimated, according to the Congressional Budget Office. Moreover, there's no guarantee Congress will agree to any of the rescission requests. And it's worth noting that what Trump calls "wasteful spending" were actually line items included in a bill he signed into law.
